frameDefinitions: An Entity is in a state such that it participates in a preponderance of states and events which are desirable for it.
A Cognizer construes an Item as belonging to a certain Category.

Commerce is a situation in which a Buyer and a Seller have agreed upon an exchange of Money and Goods (possibly after a negotiation), and then perform the exchange, optionally carrying it out with various kinds of direct payment or financing or the giving of change.
An Entity is well-known among a wide range of people (in general or in a particular domain) for a particular Reason, which may be a behavior, characteristic, or some other associated item.

An Agent has attempted to achieve a Goal, and the actual outcome of the Agent's action has been resolved, so that it either specifically matches the Agent's intent (e.g. success) or does not match it (e.g. failure).
A New filler occupies a Role or serves a Function after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
frameExamples: In the 1920s the peach industry <t>flourished</t> in Upson County.
You 've already <t>stereotyped</t> me as a bimbo, have n't you?
Shakespeare was <t>famous</t> during his life because he performed in front of Queen Elizabeth I more than anyone else.
He <t>pulled</t> <t>off</t> his April Fool's Day prank by the barest of margins .
listRoleDefinitions: The <t>Entity</t> is experiencing a period of desirable events or states.
This role describes the state of the <fen>Entity</fen>. It is often incorporated into the LUs of this frame.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> thrives.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the thriving takes place.
This is the person who performs an act of categorization. Typically, this frame element is expressed as an External Argument.
This is the entity which is construed or treated by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> as being an instance of a particular <fen>Category</fen>. Typically, the <fen>Item</fen> is expressed as an Object.

This frame element expresses a general type or class of which the <fen>Item</fen> is considered an instance. Typically, it is expressed in a prepositional phrase headed by <ment>as</ment> or <ment>under</ment>.

This frame element expresses properties of the <fen>Item</fen> which is used as a basis for categorization. <fen>Criteria</fen> are the general dimensions along which <fen>Item</fen>s can potentially differ from one another and hence, fall into different <fen>Category</fen>s. For example, a paint sample can be classified <ment>by color</ment> or <ment>by finish (matte or gloss)</ment>; if they are classified by color, one can be classified <ment>as orange</ment> and another <ment>as red</ment>. The <fen>Criteria</fen> role is typically expressed as a PP headed by <ment>by</ment>, or as a complex PP of the form <ment>on the basis of...</ment>:
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate when a certain Categorization was made.
The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The <fen>Seller</fen> has the <fen>Goods</fen> and wants the <fen>Money</fen>.
<fen>Money</fen> is given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction.
<fen>Goods</fen> is anything including labor or time, for example, which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
The <fen>Entity</fen> which is widely known and recognized.
The behavior, attribute, or associated entities that provide the reason for the <fen>Entity</fen> being famous.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is famous.
The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> is famous.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
A participant function in a particular event or in events of a particular kind.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt succeeds or fails.
The place where an attempt succeeds or fails.
The new filler of the <fen>Role</fen> that was previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen> filler.
The category that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities fit into as a result of the <fen>Function</fen> they serve.
The (generally desirable) state of affairs that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities are involved in bringing about.
The entity that occupied the <fen>Role</fen> or served the <fen>Function</fen> before the <fen>New</fen> filler.
The time at which the <fen>New</fen> takes up the <fen>Role</fen> previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen>.
listRoleExamples: In the 1920s <fex>the peach industry</fex> thrived in Upson County.
He was living <fex>well</fex> after his promotion.
<fex>In the 1920s</fex> the peach industry thrived in Upson County.
Why was it that democracy flourished <fex>in America</fex>?
<fex>Kim</fex> categorized the books under fiction. <fex>Kim</fex> categorized them on the basis of genre.
Kim categorized <fex>the books</fex> under fiction.
Kim categorized the book <fex>as/under fiction</fex>.
The students were categorized <fex>on the basis of their test scores</fex>.
<fex>20 years ago</fex> people would consider this as nothing unusual
She was considered a <fex>purchaser</fex> of the finest things
<fex>My local grocery store</fex> raised prices on meat
The price of the sweater was <fex> $50</fex>.
She was considered a purchaser <fex>of the finest things</fex>
This station is famous <fex>for the many ramen shacks surrounding it</fex>.
Certain people are well known <fex>only in North America</fex>.
<fex>John</fex> managed a feeble smile.
If you don't succeed <fex>in your subterfuge</fex>, then report back for further orders.
Benedikt was successful <fex>as a master brewer of beer</fex>.
<fex>On the bridge</fex> he succeeded in putting the wig on the corpse.
The traditional thatched roof has often been replaced <fex>by corrugated galvanized iron</fex>.
What gas replaced Hydrogen <fex>as a safer medium for use in balloons</fex> on account it does not burn?
Oil and gas replaced coal <fex>in heating homes, in industry, and in transportation</fex>.
The electron was discovered and <fex>electricity</fex> replaced gas lamps.
When electricity replaced oil <fex>in the early 1930's</fex>, the steady beam was replaced by a flashing light.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Malice N' Wonderland, 50 Cent's Before I Self Destruct
Busta Rhymes' Back On My B.S
